  1. Index

Elixir Language¶

This page shows examples of source files lexed by the same lexer, but rendered into HTML using different styles.

Some styles are richer than others in that they define more different token categories. Examples of such richer styles are the Default style, the Tango style and the Colorful style.

In all cases the lexer is the same, and the only difference is the colors defined by the styles.

Abap Style (abap)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the abap constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.abap

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
abap

module.exs¶ 

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

Algol Style (algol)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the algol constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.algol

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
algol

module.exs¶ 

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

Autumn Style (autumn)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the autumn constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

Default Style (default)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the default constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.default

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
default

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

module.exs¶ 

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

    __CALLER__
  end
end

~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

Monokai Style (monokai)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the monokai constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.monokai

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
monokai

  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions

  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

RainbowDash Style (rainbow_dash)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the rainbow_dash constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.rainbow_dash

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
rainbow_dash

module.exs¶ 

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

sandbox.exs¶ 

# Numbers
0b0101011
1234 ; 0x1A ; 0xbeef ; 0763 ; 0o123
3.14 ; 5.0e21 ; 0.5e-12
100_000_000

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# these are not valid numbers
0b012 ; 0xboar ; 0o888
0B01 ; 0XAF ; 0O123

# Characters
?a ; ?1 ; ?\n ; ?\s ; ?\c ; ? ; ?,
?\x{12} ; ?\x{abcd}
?\x34 ; ?\xF

# these show that only the first digit is part of the character
?\123 ; ?\12 ; ?\7

# Atoms
:this ; :that
:'complex atom'
:"with' \"\" 'quotes"
:" multi
 line ' \s \123 \xff
atom"
:... ; :<<>> ; :%{} ; :% ; :{}
:++; :--; :*; :~~~; :::
:% ; :. ; :<-

# Strings
"Hello world"
"Interspersed \x{ff} codes \7 \8 \65 \016 and \t\s\\s\z\+ \\ escapes"
"Quotes ' inside \" \123 the \"\" \xF \\xF string \\\" end"
"Multiline
   string"

# Char lists
'this is a list'
'escapes \' \t \\\''
'Multiline
    char
  list
'

# Binaries
<<1, 2, 3>>
<<"hello"::binary, c :: utf8, x::[4, unit(2)]>> = "helloâ„¢1"

# Sigils
~r/this + i\s "a" regex/
~R'this + i\s "a" regex too'
~w(hello #{ ["has" <> "123", '\c\d', "\123 interpol" | []] } world)s
~W(hello #{no "123" \c\d \123 interpol} world)s

~s{Escapes terminators \{ and \}, but no {balancing} # outside of sigil here }

~S"No escapes \s\t\n and no #{interpolation}"

:"atoms work #{"to" <> "o"}"

# Operators
x = 1 + 2.0 * 3
y = true and false; z = false or true
... = 144
... == !x && y || z
"hello" |> String.upcase |> String.downcase()
{^z, a} = {true, x}

# Free operators (added in 1.0.0)
p  ~>> f  = bind(p, f)
p1 ~>  p2 = pair_right(p1, p2)
p1 <~  p2 = pair_left(p1, p2)
p1 <~> p2 = pair_both(p1, p2)
p  |~> f  = map(p, f)
p1 <|> p2 = either(p1, p2)

# Lists, tuples, maps, keywords
[1, :a, 'hello'] ++ [2, 3]
[:head | [?t, ?a, ?i, ?l]]

{:one, 2.0, "three"}

[...: "this", <<>>: "is", %{}: "a keyword", %: "list", {}: "too"]
["this is an atom too": 1, "so is this": 2]
[option: "value", key: :word]
[++: "operator", ~~~: :&&&]

map = %{shortcut: "syntax"}
%{map | "update" => "me"}
%{ 12 => 13, :weird => ['thing'] }

# Comprehensions
for x <- 1..10, x < 5, do: {x, x}
pixels = "12345678"
for << <<r::4, g::4, b::4, a::size(4)>> <- pixels >> do
  [r, {g, %{"b" => a}}]
end

# String interpolation
"String #{inspect "interpolation"} is quite #{1+4+7} difficult"

# Identifiers
abc_123 = 1
_018OP = 2
A__0 == 3

# Modules
defmodule Long.Module.Name do
  @moduledoc "Simple module docstring"

  @doc """
  Multiline docstring
  "with quotes"
  and #{ inspect %{"interpolation" => "in" <> "action"} }
  now with #{ {:a, 'tuple'} }
  and #{ inspect {
      :tuple,
      %{ with: "nested #{ inspect %{ :interpolation => %{} } }" }
  } }
  """
  defstruct [:a, :name, :height]

  @doc ~S'''
  No #{interpolation} of any kind.
  \000 \x{ff}

  \n #{\x{ff}}
  '''
  def func(a, b \\ []), do: :ok

  @doc false
  def __before_compile__(_) do
    :ok
  end
end

# Structs
defmodule Second.Module do
  s = %Long.Module.Name{name: "Silly"}
  %Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}
  ".. #{%Long.Module.Name{s | height: {192, :cm}}} .."
end

# Types, pseudo-vars, attributes
defmodule M do
  @custom_attr :some_constant

  @before_compile Long.Module.Name

  @typedoc "This is a type"
  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"

Vim Style (vim)¶

To use this style just require the Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap module and access the vim constant: 

# styles are macros that expand to constants
require Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
alias Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
StyleMap.vim

Or import the module and use the constant defined there: 

import Makeup.Styles.HTML.StyleMap
vim

module.exs¶ 

defmodule MyModule do
  @moduledoc """
  This is documentation for the module
  """
  
  @doc """
  This is documentation for the function
  """
  def f(x) do
    x + x + x
  end
  # That's all, folks!
end

  @type typ :: integer

  @typedoc """
  Another type
  """
  @opaque typtyp :: 1..10

  @spec func(typ, typtyp) :: :ok | :fail
  def func(a, b) do
    a || b || :ok || :fail
    Path.expand("..", __DIR__)
    IO.inspect __ENV__
    __NOTAPSEUDOVAR__ = 11
    __MODULE__.func(b, a)
  end

  defmacro m() do
    __CALLER__
  end
end

# Functions
anon = fn x, y, z ->
  fn(a, b, c) ->
    &(x + y - z * a / &1 + b + div(&2, c))
  end
end

&Set.put(&1, &2) ; & Set.put(&1, &2) ; &( Set.put(&1, &1) )

# Function calls
anon.(1, 2, 3); self; hd([1,2,3])
Kernel.spawn(fn -> :ok end)
IO.ANSI.black

# Control flow
if :this do
  :that
else
  :otherwise
end

pid = self
receive do
  {:EXIT, _} -> :done
  {^pid, :_} -> nil
  after 100 -> :no_luck
end

case __ENV__.line do
  x when is_integer(x) -> x
  x when x in 1..12 -> -x
end

cond do
  false -> "too bad"
  4 > 5 -> "oops"
  true -> nil
end

# Lexical scope modifiers
import Kernel, except: [spawn: 1, +: 2, /: 2, Unless: 2]
alias Long.Module.Name, as: N0men123_and4
use Bitwise

4 &&& 5
2 <<< 3

# Protocols
defprotocol Useless do
  def func1(this)
  def func2(that)
end

defimpl Useless, for: Atom do
end

# Exceptions
defmodule NotAnError do
  defexception [:message]
end

raise NotAnError, message: "This is not an error"
